channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Coronavirus death toll in China overtakes SARS outbreak
Outbreak turns China's gambling mecca into a ghost town
Video shows timelapse of hospital being built in under a week
item.description: Thousands of workers and machines are working non-stop on two new hospitals for coronavirus patients in Wuhan, China.

item.title: First chance for US voters to choose who should face Trump
These Iowa voters support different candidates but agree on this
item.description: CNN's John King speaks with four Iowa voters about who they support for the Democratic nomination in the 2020 presidential race.

item.title: Schiff implores Senators to 'stand up to lawlessness and tyranny' as trial winds down
The next three days may reshape American politics
HIV vaccine trial ends in 'deep disappointment'
item.description: A clinical trial for an HIV vaccine has been discontinued since the vaccine was not found to prevent infections of human immunodeficiency virus, the virus that causes AIDS.

item.title: Trump congratulates Kansas on Super Bowl win. But there's one problem with that
Air Canada plane to make emergency landing in Spain
item.description: An Air Canada plane will make an emergency landing in Madrid's Barajas airport, Spain's air navigation manager Enaire tweeted on Monday.

item.title: Former WorldCom CEO, who went to prison in $11B accounting fraud case, is dead
item.description: Bernard Ebbers, the former CEO of WorldCom, who went to prison in 2006 for his role in an $11 billion accounting fraud case, has died.

item.title: BAFTAs best moments: Awkward Prince Harry jokes to calls for diversity
item.description: The British Academy Film Awards was a thrilling night of politically charged speeches, awkward gags and Rebel Wilson at her self-deprecating best.

item.title: Jill Biden: I don't know what happened to Lindsey Graham, he used to be a friend
item.description: Jill Biden tells CNN's John Berman that Sen. Lindsey Graham used to be a family friend but that he has "changed" since the election of President Donald Trump.

item.title: Scientists discovered a weed compound that may be 30 times more powerful than THC
item.description: A newly discovered cannabis compound has been shown in the lab to potentially be 30 times more potent than THC, the most studied psychoactive compound in marijuana.

item.title: Brexit is days old and already Britain and the EU are arguing about what comes next
item.description: Britain and the European Union have taken their first steps toward negotiating a new free trade deal, staking out sharply divergent positions Monday that point to more fraught negotiations and another year of uncertainty for businesses.

item.title: Study: Stop believing that red and processed meats are OK for your health
item.description: If you've been swayed by recent reports that red and processed meat isn't harmful to your health, put down that bacon -- there's bad news.

item.title: Unexploded WWII bomb in central London prompts evacuations
item.description: Police have evacuated a number of streets in central London after an unexploded World War II bomb was discovered.

item.title: Turkey suffers first deaths in direct combat with Syria since start of war
item.description: Four Turkish soldiers were killed in Syria on Sunday, Turkey's first fatalities as a result of direct confrontation between the countries since the start of Syria's civil war in 2011.

item.title: 6 passengers shot on a Greyhound bus in California
item.description: Six passengers on a Greyhound bus headed from Los Angeles to San Francisco were shot early Sunday morning, the California Highway Patrol said.

item.title: 'Mad Mike' Hoare, world-famous mercenary, dies aged 100
item.description: Michael "Mad Mike" Hoare, one of the world's best-known mercenaries, has died at the age of 100, his family has confirmed.

item.title: Lagos bans motorcycle taxis, leaving commuters stranded
item.description: Police and motorcycle riders have clashed in parts of Lagos, Nigeria's commercial hub, following a controversial ban on commercial motorcycles and tricycles in major parts of the state.

item.title: How the Boeing 737 Max crisis is hurting the plane's biggest buyer in Europe
item.description: Ryanair's ambition to carry 200 million passengers by 2024 could be delayed by two years because of Boeing's 737 Max crisis.

item.title: Ex-One Direction star slams BBC Breakfast show for pressing him about his grief
item.description: Former One Direction star Louis Tomlinson has vowed never to return to the UK's BBC Breakfast show, after a promotional pitstop for his debut solo album, "Walls," saw him quizzed about his experience of bereavement.

item.title: CNN on the red carpet at this year's BAFTA awards
item.description: Joaquin Phoenix, Rebel Wilson, and BAFTA president Prince William criticized the lack of diversity among the nominated creators and performers this awards season, saying the issue can no longer be ignored. CNN's Isa Soares reports from the Royal Albert Hall, London.

item.title: 9 reasons the Indian CEO keeps coming to the rescue
item.description: IBM tapped Arvind Krishna as its next CEO last week. And this week WeWork confirmed it hired Sandeep Mathrani as its new chief executive.

item.title: Six months of protests wrecked Hong Kong's economy. A virus scare is the last thing this city needs
item.description: Months of increasingly violent protests and a bruising US-China trade war pushed Hong Kong into a recession last year for the first time in a decade. Now the coronavirus outbreak threatens to derail things once again.

item.title: 5G won't be the disruptive change many claim it will be
item.description: Telecommunications providers relentlessly extol the power of fifth-generation (5G) wireless technology. Government officials and policy advocates fret that the winner of the "5G race" will dominate the internet of the future, so America cannot afford to lose out. Pundits declare that 5G will revolutionize the digital world. It all sounds very thrilling. Unfortunately, the hype has gone too far.

item.title: 'SNL' reimagines the impeachment trial
item.description: "Saturday Night Live's" reimagined impeachment trial had Judge Mathis, played by Kenan Thompson, presiding, and Hunter Biden, played by Pete Davidson, as a witness.

item.title: An 11-year-old boy went to play at a friend's house last week. No one has seen him since
item.description: Colorado authorities are looking for an 11-year-old boy who has been missing for a week after he went to play at a friend's house, the El Paso County Sheriff's Office said.

item.title: After a tough battle with brain cancer, a 4-month-old rang the 'cancer-free' bell in emotional video
item.description: After a monthslong battle with brain and spinal cancer, 4-month-old Lillian Grace finally rang the "cancer-free" bell at the hospital -- and the moment, posted on Facebook by Lily's mom, pulls at the heartstrings.

item.title: Djokovic says tough upbringing makes him hungrier for success
item.description: Be it trying to become the all-time men's grand slam leader or simply needing a spark in matches, Novak Djokovic said after winning a record eighth Australian Open title that his motivation comes from when times were tougher for the Serb and his family.

item.title: Seal filmed 'clapping' its flippers in the wild for the first time
item.description: Although seals are known to clap their flippers in captivity, a gray seal has been filmed doing it in the wild for the very first time, researchers say.

item.title: Fireflies are facing extinction
item.description: Around the world, fireflies light up the night with their shimmering bodies. But scientists say this magical display is under threat -- with the loss of their natural habitats, pesticide use and artificial light putting some of the 2,000 or so species at risk of extinction.

item.title: Pamela Anderson and Jon Peters split 12 days after their wedding
item.description: Pamela Anderson and Jon Peters are calling it quits after just 12 days of marriage.

item.title: Heard of the low sulfur diet? Eating low-protein may prolong your life, say researchers
item.description: Fasting. Time-restricted eating. Eating for five days, then fasting for two. Lately it appears everyone is interested in some sort of calorie-restricted diet to better their chances for a longer life with fewer chronic diseases.

item.title: Inside Kim and Kanye's stunning Los Angeles mansion
item.description: Kim Kardashian West and Kanye West have opened the doors of their California mansion to Architectural Digest magazine, which defines it as a "wildly idiosyncratic family refuge in suburban Los Angeles." The couple had previously shown glimpses of the home via Instagram, but they have now revealed in detail how they transformed the estate -- which they bought in 2014 -- into a "futuristic Belgian monastery," as Kanye put it.

item.title: 'Child prodigy' seals Barcelona win
item.description: Barcelona's teenage sensation Ansu Fati was left pinching himself after the first double of his fledgling career earned the club a narrow 2-1 win over Levante.

item.title: Smart watches help this factory customize cars
item.description: Through its creative embrace of technology, the BMW plant in a medieval German city is helping to revolutionize manufacturing.

item.title: The hottest BAFTA red carpet looks
item.description: Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge, took a stand for sustainable fashion on Sunday night, re-wearing a familiar Alexander McQueen gown to the 73rd annual British Academy Film Awards (BAFTAs).

item.title: Why Billie Eilish is cleaning up her world tour
item.description: Her neon-colored hair isn't the only thing about pop superstar Billie Eilish that's gone green. The five-time Grammy winner is part of the growing number of musicians who are going eco-friendly on the road.

item.title: Couple sues airline after being kicked off flight for 'body odor'
item.description: An Orthodox Jewish couple is suing American Airlines for discrimination, alleging that they were kicked off a flight for what an employee called "extremely offensive body odor."

item.title: Discover Picasso's most famous paintings
item.description: It's hard to imagine a visual record of the 20th century without Pablo Ruiz Picasso. With his bold shapes and characteristic angles, the Spanish artist captured everything from the horrors of war to the boundless possibilities of the human form.

item.title: 20 of the world's best new restaurants
item.description: From Mexican dishes with a stellar view across the rooftops of London to Ethiopian cuisine in upstate New York, Mediterranean creativity in Bangkok to a Texas-inspired grill in Hong Kong, many of the most exciting new restaurants opening this year take their cue from global cuisines.

item.title: Since its outbreak in December, more than 360 people have died of the disease in mainland China
Outbreak leaves Macao shell-shocked
item.description: There isn't a single face exposed in the cavernous Galaxy casino. Everyone is wearing a mask, including the croupiers, waitresses and security guards -- who happen to vastly outnumber the scattered customers gambling at blackjack and roulette tables.

item.title: China accuses US of overreacting to coronavirus
item.description: The US has begun implementing new rules around travel from China as the coronavirus death toll creeps higher -- rules that include re-routing Americans flying into the country to specific airports for screening.

item.title: Everything travelers need to know about the virus
item.description: Much is still unknown about the Wuhan coronavirus outbreak, and health officials are urging vigilance.

item.title: Hong Kong announces new border closures
item.description: The number of Wuhan coronavirus deaths in mainland China has overtaken the 2003 severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) epidemic in the country, as Beijing injected billions of dollars into an economy hit by weeks of effective shutdowns to major cities.

item.title: Trump defense team delivers closing arguments
item.description: Opinion: The penalty Trump should get if the Senate acquits

item.title: The next three days may reshape American politics
item.description: First chance for US voters to choose who should face Trump Predicting the 5 most likely Iowa scenarios
